page.title: 20HOPES AND FEARS
page.content: I consider myself fortunate to live in this beautiful part of Thurnham. From our garden I look out across many thousands of acres of farmland - a peaceful place to retreat from the bustle of everyday life. It is difficult to think ahead but the thing that frightens me most is war. I am not pacifist, indeed quite the opposite, but I hope my son may grow up into a peaceful world. Perhaps the energy put in by young people to raising vast sums of money to help the starving can be turned into evergy to bring peace to the troubled places of the world eg. Lebanon, India, Ireland. Can the young bring to the world a less warlike outlook? I wish I could help to show people that violence is not the answer to all their problems.
